answers.answer: I have GD & my fluid is right on point.  I wouldn't worry too much unless they tell you to worry, and remember no Google!!  Lol adds unnecessary stress to your pregnancy
I second Sweetbee.It's better to speak to your consultant/GP rather than search Google. Google sometimes stresses people out for no reasons with their endless info.
I know google is torture lol. I was in such bad pain all of last night like in my hips and I've had period like cramps constantly since yesterday so I will call midwife today.

question: Had any one had this and gone to full term I'm now 31 weeks but I went to an appointment at 30 weeks but was measuring 35. I was sent for a gestational diabetes test and I haven't heard back which usually means no news is good news. I have a scan booked for Wednesday to check why there is so much fluid. But silly old me googled and most people go in to preterm labour according to me google. I have just got over bv and stopped worrying about early labour from that and now this!  Any advice would be greatly appreciated.
title: Polyhydramnios / excess fluid
